title: Shoppers swarm to catch Boxing Day sales as retail sector rebounds | ABC NEWS
description: An ongoing cost-of-living crunch has not discouraged shoppers from opening their wallets in record fashion to hunt for Boxing Day bargains. The retail sector is on the rebound, with sale-hungry Australians predicted to spend more than $1.5b on Boxing Day alone in 2025. title: Police name person of interest in arson attack on 'Happy Chanukah' car in Melbourne | ABC NEWS
description: Police in Melbourne have named a person of interest as they investigate an arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration in the early hours of Christmas morning. On Friday, detectives urged John Argento, a 47-year-old who lived a transient lifestyle in Melbourne, to contact police. title: Why are voters boycotting Myanmar's first election in five years? | ABC NEWS
description: Five years after Myanmar's military coup that ousted Nobel laureate Aung San Suu Kyi, the country is set to hold elections. The junta claims the upcoming elections will restore civilian rule in Myanmar, but Western governments and civil rights groups widely view the elections as a sham meant to keep the generals in power through their affiliated political parties.  While there are calls for a boycott, the elections have unexpectedly received support from Ko Ko Gyi, a candidate for the People's Party and a respected pro-democracy activist. title: Jewish security company warned of heightened risks during Hanukkah | ABC NEWS
description: A leaked document has revealed a Jewish security organisation warned of an increased risk of violent antisemitism during Hanukkah, just weeks before the Bondi attack. The document, which was reviewed by ABC, raised concerns about Islamic extremism and the potential for lone-actor attacks.
